get.summary: Lists all rolled up check results
get.description:
Lists the rolled up check results *per hour* for a specific check.

This means that one hour after a raw result for a check is recorded, it is also available in the rolled up results.

The result contains all discrete response times and aggregated counters for failing and successful check. Using this data you can reconstruct averages, percentiles and ratios, approximating the individual raw check results very closely.

You can filter by check type and result type to narrow down the list. Use the `to` and `from` parameters to specify a date range. Depending on the check type, some fields might be null.

Note that results from this endpoint start at roughly *2019-4-11*, earlier results are not available.

parameters.description: Provide a data center location, e.g. "eu-west-1" to filter by location
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: Select results up to this UNIX timestamp date, i.e. < date
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: Select results from this UNIX timestamp date, i.e. >= date
parameters.name: from

get.description:
Lists the full, raw check results for a specific check. We keep raw results for 30 days. After 30 days they are erased. However we keep the rolled up results for an indefinite period.

You can filter by check type and result type to narrow down the list. Use the `to` and `from` parameters to specify a date range (UNIX timestamp in seconds). Depending on the check type, some fields might be null.

parameters.name: checkId
parameters.description: Your Checkly account ID, you can find it at https://app.checklyhq.com/settings/account/general

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Limit the number of results
Provide a data center location, e.g. "eu-west-1" to filter by location
parameters.name: location

parameters.description: Select results up to this UNIX timestamp date in seconds, i.e. < date
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: Select results from this UNIX timestamp date in seconds, i.e. >= date
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: The type of the check
parameters.name: checkType

parameters.description: Check result has one or more failures
parameters.name: hasFailures

parameters.description: Check result has one or more failures
parameters.name: hasFailures

get.summary: Generates a customizable report for all Browser Check metrics. Allows aggregations like sum and p99. [ALPHA]
get.description: Generates a report with aggregated or non-aggregated statistics for a specific Browser Check over a specified time window.

parameters.description: Your Checkly account ID, you can find it at https://app.checklyhq.com/settings/account/general
parameters.name: x-checkly-account

parameters.description: Custom start time of reporting window in unix timestamp format. Setting a custom "from" timestamp overrides the use of any "presetWindow".
parameters.name: from

parameters.description: Custom end time of reporting window in unix timestamp format. Setting a custom "to" timestamp overrides the use of any "presetWindow".
parameters.name: to

parameters.description: Preset reporting windows are used for quickly generating report on commonly used windows. Can be overridden by using a custom "to" and "from" timestamp.
parameters.name: presetWindow

parameters.description: The time interval to use for aggregating metrics in minutes. For example, five minutes is 300, 24 hours is 1440.
parameters.name: aggregationInterval

parameters.description: Determines how the series data is grouped.
parameters.name: groupBy

parameters.description: Use status to filter for check either failing or successful check result data.
parameters.name: filterByStatus

parameters.description: metrics options for browser checks
parameters.name: metrics

Bearer.name: Authorization
Bearer.description:
The Checkly Public API uses API keys to authenticate requests. You can get the API Key here.
Your API key is like a password:
keep it secure!

Authentication to the API is performed using the Bearer auth method in the Authorization header and using the account ID.

For example, set Authorization header while using cURL: curl -H "Authorization: Bearer [apiKey]" "X-Checkly-Account: [accountId]"

subscriptions.description: All checks subscribed to this channel.

type.description: The type of alert channel, i.e. EMAIL or SLACK.

sslExpiry.description: Determines if an alert should be send for expiring SSL certificates.

sslExpiryThreshold.description: At what moment in time to start alerting on SSL certificates.

assertions.description: Check the main Checkly documentation on assertions for specific values like regular expressions and JSON path descriptors you can use in the "property" field.

url.description: The base url for this group which you can reference with the {{GROUP_BASE_URL}} variable in all group checks.

key.description: The key of the environment variable (this value cannot be changed).

value.description: The value of the environment variable.

locked.description: Used only in the UI to hide the value like a password

environmentVariables.description: Key/value pairs for setting environment variables during check execution. Use global environment variables whenever possible.

failedRunThreshold.description: After how many failed consecutive check runs an alert notification should be send

minutesFailingThreshold.description: After how many minutes after a check starts failing an alert should be send

amount.description: How many reminders to send out after the initial alert notification

interval.description: At what interval the reminders should be send

enabled.description: Determines if alert notifications should be send for expiring SSL certificates

alertThreshold.description: At what moment in time to start alerting on SSL certificates

escalationType.description: Determines what type of escalation to use

Tags.description: Tags for organizing and filtering checks

Locations.description: An array of one or more data center locations where to run the checks

EnvironmentVariables.description: Key/value pairs for setting environment variables during check execution. These are only relevant for Browser checks. Use global environment variables whenever possible.

frequency.description: How often the check should run in minutes.

activated.description: Determines if the check is running or not

muted.description: Determines if any notifications will be send out when a check fails and/or recovers

doubleCheck.description: Setting this to "true" will trigger a retry when a check fails from the failing region and another, randomly selected region before marking the check as failed

sslCheck.description: Determines if the SSL certificate should be validated for expiry

shouldFail.description: Allows to invert the behaviour of when a check is considered to fail. Allows for validating error status like 404

script.description: A valid piece of Node.js javascript code describing a browser interaction with the Puppeteer or Playwright frameworks.

setupSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the setup phase of an API check

tearDownSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the teardown phase of an API check

localSetupScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the setup phase

localTearDownScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the teardown phase

useGlobalAlertSettings.description: When true, the account level alert setting will be used, not the alert setting defined on this check

degradedResponseTime.description: The response time in milliseconds where a check should be considered degraded

maxResponseTime.description: The response time in milliseconds where a check should be considered failing

groupId.description: The id of the check group this check is part of

groupOrder.description: The position of this check in a check group. It determines in what order checks are run when a group is triggered from the API or from CI/CD

runtimeId.description: The runtime version, i.e. fixed set of runtime dependencies, used to execute this check.

frequency.description: How often the check should run in minutes.

activated.description: Determines if the check is running or not

muted.description: Determines if any notifications will be send out when a check fails and/or recovers

doubleCheck.description: Setting this to "true" will trigger a retry when a check fails from the failing region and another, randomly selected region before marking the check as failed

sslCheck.description: Determines if the SSL certificate should be validated for expiry

shouldFail.description: Allows to invert the behaviour of when a check is considered to fail. Allows for validating error status like 404

script.description: A valid piece of Node.js javascript code describing a browser interaction with the Puppeteer or Playwright frameworks.

setupSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the setup phase of an API check

tearDownSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the teardown phase of an API check

localSetupScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the setup phase

localTearDownScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the teardown phase

useGlobalAlertSettings.description: When true, the account level alert setting will be used, not the alert setting defined on this check

degradedResponseTime.description: The response time in milliseconds where a check should be considered degraded

maxResponseTime.description: The response time in milliseconds where a check should be considered failing

groupId.description: The id of the check group this check is part of

groupOrder.description: The position of this check in a check group. It determines in what order checks are run when a group is triggered from the API or from CI/CD

runtimeId.description: The runtime version, i.e. fixed set of runtime dependencies, used to execute this check.

runLocation.description: What data center location this set of check results originated from

errorCount.description: The total amount of errored out check results for this hour. This value should be 0 in almost all cases as it records failures in the Checkly backend.

failureCount.description: The total amount of failed check results for this hour.

resultsCount.description: The total amount of results recorded for this hour. Depends on how often this check is scheduled to run.

hour.description: All results per time unit / per location are rolled up to a specific hour

id.description: The unique ID of this result

hasFailures.description: Describes if any failure has occurred during this check run. This is should be your mainmain focus for assessing API or browser check behaviour. Assertions that fail, timeouts or failing scripts all resolve tothis value being true

hasErrors.description: Describes if an internal error has occured in Checkly's backend. This should be false in almost all cases.

isDegraded.description: A check is degraded if it is over the degradation limit set by the "degradedResponseTime" field on the check. Applies only to API checks.

overMaxResponseTime.description: Set to true if the response time is over the limit set by the "maxResponseTime" field on the check. Applies only to API checks.

runLocation.description: What data center location this check result originated from

responseTime.description: Describes the time it took to execute relevant parts of this check. Any setup timeor system time needed to start executing this check in the Checkly backend is not part of this.

checkRunId.description: The id of the specific check run that created this check result

attempts.description: How often this check was retried. This will be larger than 0 when double checking is enabled

checkId.description: The ID of check this status belongs to

hasFailures.description: Describes if this check is currently failing. If any of the assertions for an API checkfail this value is true. If a browser check fails for whatever reason, this is true

hasErrors.description: Describes if due to some error outside of normal operation this check is failing. This should be extremely rare and only when there is an error in the Checkly backend

isDegraded.description: A check is degraded if it is over the degradation limit set by the "degradedResponseTime" field on the check. Applies only to API checks.

longestRun.description: The longest ever recorded response time for this check

shortestRun.description: The shortest ever recorded response time for this check

lastRunLocation.description: What location this check was last run at

lastCheckRunId.description: The unique incrementing ID for each check run

sslDaysRemaining.description: How many days remain till the current SSL certificate expires

frequency.description: How often the check should run in minutes.

activated.description: Determines if the check is running or not

muted.description: Determines if any notifications will be send out when a check fails and/or recovers

doubleCheck.description: Setting this to "true" will trigger a retry when a check fails from the failing region and another, randomly selected region before marking the check as failed

sslCheck.description: Determines if the SSL certificate should be validated for expiry

shouldFail.description: Allows to invert the behaviour of when a check is considered to fail. Allows for validating error status like 404

script.description: A valid piece of Node.js javascript code describing a browser interaction with the Puppeteer or Playwright frameworks.

setupSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the setup phase of an API check

tearDownSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the teardown phase of an API check

localSetupScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the setup phase

localTearDownScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the teardown phase

useGlobalAlertSettings.description: When true, the account level alert setting will be used, not the alert setting defined on this check

degradedResponseTime.description: The response time in milliseconds where a check should be considered degraded

maxResponseTime.description: The response time in milliseconds where a check should be considered failing

groupId.description: The id of the check group this check is part of

groupOrder.description: The position of this check in a check group. It determines in what order checks are run when a group is triggered from the API or from CI/CD

runtimeId.description: The runtime version, i.e. fixed set of runtime dependencies, used to execute this check.

frequencyOffset.description: Used for setting seconds for check frequencies under 1 minutes (only for API checks) and spreading checks over a time range for frequencies over 1 minute. This works as follows: Checks with a frequency of 0 can have a frequencyOffset of 10, 20 or 30 meaning they will run every 10, 20 or 30 seconds. Checks with a frequency lower than and equal to 60 can have a frequencyOffset between 1 and a max value based on the formula "Math.floor(frequency * 10)", i.e. for a check that runs every 5 minutes the max frequencyOffset is 50. Checks with a frequency higher than 60 can have a frequencyOffset between 1 and a max value based on the formula "Math.ceil(frequency / 60)", i.e. for a check that runs every 720 minutes, the max frequencyOffset is 12.

customUrl.description: A subdomain name under "checklyhq.com". Needs to be unique across all users.

customDomain.description: A custom user domain, e.g. "status.example.com". See the docs on updating your DNS and SSL usage.

logo.description: A URL pointing to an image file.

header.description: A piece of text displayed at the top of your dashboard.

width.description: Determines whether to use the full screen or focus in the center.

refreshRate.description: How often to refresh the dashboard in seconds.

paginate.description: Determines of pagination is on or off.

paginationRate.description: How often to trigger pagination in seconds.

hideTags.description: Show or hide the tags on the dashboard.

script.description: Your Node.js code that interacts with the API check lifecycle, or functions as a partial for browser checks.
Your Node.js code that interacts with the API check lifecycle, or functions as a partial for browser checks.

url.description: The base url for this group which you can reference with the {{GROUP_BASE_URL}} variable in all group checks.

name.description: The name of the check group

activated.description: Determines if the checks in the  group are running or not

muted.description: Determines if any notifications will be send out when a check in this group fails and/or recovers

concurrency.description: Determines how many checks are invoked concurrently when triggering a check group from CI/CD or through the API.

doubleCheck.description: Setting this to "true" will trigger a retry when a check fails from the failing region and another, randomly selected region before marking the check as failed

useGlobalAlertSettings.description: When true, the account level alert setting will be used, not the alert setting defined on this check group

setupSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the setup phase of an API check in this group

tearDownSnippetId.description: An ID reference to a snippet to use in the teardown phase of an API check in this group

localSetupScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the setup phase of an API check in this group

localTearDownScript.description: A valid piece of Node.js code to run in the teardown phase of an API check in this group

Model_6.description: An array of one or more data center locations where to run the this check

id.description: The id of the maintenance window

startsAt.description: The start date of the maintenance window

endsAt.description: The end date of the maintenance window

repeatInterval.description: The repeat interval of the maintenance window from the first occurance

AlertChanelSubscriptionList.description: All checks subscribed to this channel.

sslExpiry.description: Determines if an alert should be send for expiring SSL certificates.

sslExpiryThreshold.description: At what moment in time to start alerting on SSL certificates.

id.description: The unique ID of this alert.

checkId.description: The ID of check this alert belongs to.

runLocation.description: What data center location this check alert was triggered from.

responseTime.description: Describes the time it took to execute relevant parts of this check. Any setup timeor system time needed to start executing this check in the Checkly backend is not part of this.

error.description: Any specific error messages that were part of the failing check triggering the alert.

statusCode.description: The status code of the response. Only applies to API checks.

created_at.description: The date and time this check alert was created.

startedAt.description: The date and time this check alert was started.

AssertionList.description: Check the main Checkly documentation on assertions for specific values like regular expressions and JSON path descriptors you can use in the "property" field.

failedRunThreshold.description: After how many failed consecutive check runs an alert notification should be send.

minutesFailingThreshold.description: After how many minutes after a check starts failing an alert should be send.

amount.description: How many reminders to send out after the initial alert notification.

interval.description: At what interval the reminders should be send.

region.description: The unique identifier of this location.

checkAssignments.description: The check this private location has assigned.

name.description: The name assigned to the private location.

successRatio.description: Success ratio of the check over selected date range. Percentage is in decimal form.

avg.description: Average response time of the check over selected date range in milliseconds.

p95.description: P95 response time of the check over selected date range in milliseconds.

p99.description: P99 response time of the check over selected date range in milliseconds.

name.description: The unique name of this runtime.

stage.description: Current life stage of a runtime.

runtimeEndOfLife.description: Date which a runtime will be removed from our platform.

default.description: Indicates if this is the current default runtime provided by Checkly.

description.description: A short, human readable description of the main updates in this runtime.
description.example: Main updates are Playwright 1.15.2 and Puppeteer 10.4.0

dependencies.description: An object with all dependency package names and versions as in a standard package.json.

key.description: The key of the environment variable (this value cannot be changed).

value.description: The value of the environment variable.

locked.description: Used only in the UI to hide the value like a password.
